citation.title: SRD5B1 (AKR1D1) gene analysis in delta(4)-3-oxosteroid 5beta-reductase deficiency: evidence for primary genetic defect.

comment.text: Efficiently catalyzes the reduction of progesterone, androstenedione, 17-alpha-hydroxyprogesterone and testosterone to 5-beta-reduced metabolites. The bile acid intermediates 7-alpha,12-alpha-dihydroxy-4-cholesten-3-one and 7-alpha-hydroxy-4-cholesten-3-one can also act as substrates.
Subject to inhibition by high substrate concentrations. Inhibited by testosterone concentrations above 10 uM.
Highly expressed in liver. Expressed in testis and weakly in colon.

disease.name: Congenital bile acid synthesis defect 2
disease.description: A condition characterized by jaundice, intrahepatic cholestasis and hepatic failure. Patients with this liver disease show absence or low levels of chenodeoxycholic acid and cholic acid in plasma and urine.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the aldo/keto reductase family.

property.value: Congenital bile acid synthesis defect type 2
Synthesis of bile acids and bile salts via 7alpha-hydroxycholesterol
Synthesis of bile acids and bile salts via 24-hydroxycholesterol
Synthesis of bile acids and bile salts via 27-hydroxycholesterol
